title: Study Models of Parts of the Body
description: Beeldhouwersmodel vastklampende rechterhand en pols (naar het antieke beeld van Menelaos en Patroclus, Loggia dei Lanzi in Florence, of naar de versie in Rome, bekend als Pasquino).

principalMakers.name: Johan Gregor van der Schardt
principalMakers.labelDesc: attributed to Johan Gregor van der Schardt (1530 - c. 1581), Italy

documentation: Frits Scholten, 'Michelangelo's Mighty Models or the Legacy of Johan Gregor van der Schardt', in Stephan Koja en Claudia Kryza-Gersch (red.): Shadows of Time : Giambologna, Michelangelo and the Medici Chapel, Dresden 2018, p. 93-111.
longTitle: Study Models of Parts of the Body, Johan Gregor van der Schardt (attributed to), c. 1560 - in or before 1570
subTitle: h 10.7cm
scLabelLine: Johan Gregor van der Schardt (1530-c. 1581), terracotta, c. 1560-1570

label.title: Study Models of Parts of the Body
label.makerLine: Johan Gregor van der Schardt (1530-c. 1581), terracotta, c. 1560-1570
label.description: This group of small models of parts of the body are carefully copied after famous sculptures, in particular by Michelangelo, in Florence and Rome. They came from the workshop of the Nijmegen sculptor Johan Gregor van der Schardt, who had a successful career in Italy, Nuremberg, and Copenhagen. They are extremely rare examples of the, in part autograph, study material of a 16th-century sculptor.
